name: ALT Hotel Quartier DIX30

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -Close to the lifestyle centre Quartier Dix30 (http://www.quartierdix30.com/activities/) with lots of stores and stylish restaurants
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: It's ok for Brossard

reviews.text: Imagine you have a friend in his or her early twenties who moved to London or New York City and got a job as a successful club DJ. This hotel is what his/ her loft condo would look like. You have exposed concrete walls, a black, grey and white colour scheme, halogen lighting, and fixtures in the style of Ikea. A multimedia centre under the wall-mounted flatscreen TV accepts USB connections and HDMI. Continuing the DJ theme, there is even a DJ in the lobby during the evening spinning tunes. Certainly you will find this hotel memorable and unique, and the non- mainstream fixtures make it feel like you are staying at a friend's place as opposed to staying in a hotel. Great for younger travelers or for a romantic night. What's more, the price is excellent for the amenities you receive. Now for a few quibbles:
reviews.title: Memorable and unique

likes.liked: — Unique hotel experience at a good price
likes.disliked: — Dix30 is extremely difficult to navigate

reviews.text: New hotel, has quirks for the price. Trying to be green but seeing waste in doing so, nice thought but overly trendy made it a bit silly here and there. Also, wish they had a better deal with the neigbor spa/pool or did not advertise pool at all. $20 per day to use and only if you are over 16 otherwise no pool for you! Also inroom internet service was alloways "not working" and they claimed it was our computer but really, I think it was due to to much use on their system that they could not support.
reviews.title: Need to iron out some quirks

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was there to celebrate a special event with my girlfriend. I booked a special package offer that included Room and Massage Spa.
reviews.title: When service quality isn't there... can ruin the best hotel in the world!

reviews.text: As soon as we arrived, we were pleased with the room we had (room 1001). Only negative point about the room is that the window blinds let the sun get in the room way too much (especially if you are there to rest and sleep). I also stayed at the Alt in Quebec City and they are not using the same kind of window blinds and at 12h00, you could almost believe it is 24h00. Other than that, room was very comfortable, had a great style and was overall almost perfect.
reviews.title: Great place to stay for a shopping spree!

reviews.text: A couple of hours later, we had our appointment at the spa/massage. We thought that everything was included (towels, sandales, and so on) but unfortunately, it wasn't the case. So, we had to pay another 20$ to buy cheap sandales otherwise, we wouldn't have been admited at the spa. Before I purchased them, I decided to call at the Alt Hotel (in order to report that situation and see if there could be a possible arrangement). I have been terribly shoked by the way I was answered by the front desk clerk. She really had a bad attitude with me, using words that were unappropriate and unacceptable for a person doing her job. I was suppose to be there to relax and here I was upset not because of the 20$ I had to pay but because of this rude person that didn't even try to understand and accomodate me with my problem when it is mainly the reason why she is getting paid for! Remember that I paid for an all included formula and that all informations should have been provided either by the website or by the clerk who took the order.
reviews.title: expensive

reviews.text: There's no need for me to tell you my job and profession but let's say that I am a manager dealing with clients everyday... all kind of clients and even if we are sometimes talking about millions, we never get to the point were we are rude and very impolite. I never get that kind of argumentation with anyone near me. I am easy going and naturally very accomodating.
reviews.title: LOVED this Modern Hotel!

description: Being ALTernative means moving in new directionsALT is the balance between modernity, a dynamic and colourful ambience, comfort, and well-thought out location.At ALT, eco-responsability means doing away with room service, valets and doormen: ALT focuses on your needs, on the essential things that bring added value to your stay.Our "service light" approach allows us to offer guests a unique rate: the same price, every day, all year round!When you choose ALT, you are opting for a hotel with centralized free WiFi access and much more!The ALT Hotel banner belongs to Groupe Germain Hospitality, a Canadian family owned company, pioneer of the Hotel-boutique concept, with its headquarters in Quebec City.
